result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Woodway USA/witnesses A & B/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Spanish version of waiver filed as well.

8:44 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Jose A Saavedra-Espinoza in court.  Attorney Erik I. Colque Aty in court for Jose A Saavedra-Espinoza. Dawn Maldonado appeared by Zoom as interpreter and previous sworn in.All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED AT NEXT COURT DATE.

This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
